SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.view

Class ViewController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.view.ViewController
public class ViewController extends Object
This class acts as the controller communicating with the board to perform checks and modify it.

  • Constructor Details

    • ViewController

      public ViewController(ViewBoard board)
      Constructs the ViewController and sets the ViewBoard reference
      Parameters:
      board - the game's ViewBoard to be used by this ViewController

  • Method Details

    • validatePlaceStartCard

      public void validatePlaceStartCard() throws IllegalStateException, IllegalArgumentException
      Validates whether the place starting card command can be run.
      Successfully returning from this method means passing the check.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the starting card can't be placed at the time of invocation. The exception message explains the reason in greater detail.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the player has no starting card in hand.

    • validateChooseColor

      public void validateChooseColor() throws IllegalStateException
      Validates whether the choose color command can be run.
      Successfully returning from this method means passing the check.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the color can't be chosen at the time of invocation. The exception message explains the reason in greater detail.

    • validateChooseObjective

      public void validateChooseObjective() throws IllegalStateException
      Validates whether the choose objective command can be run.
      Successfully returning from this method means passing the check.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the objective can't be chosen at the time of invocation. The exception message explains the reason in greater detail.

    • validatePhase

      public void validatePhase(GamePhase phase) throws IllegalStateException
      Validates whether the current GamePhase is the same as phase.
      Successfully returning from this method means passing the check.
      Parameters:
      phase - the desired GamePhase
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the current GamePhase and phase don't match.

    • validatePlaceCard

      public void validatePlaceCard(String cardID, GamePoint placePos, String cornerDir) throws IllegalStateException, IllegalArgumentException
      Validates whether the place card command can be run.
      Successfully returning from this method means passing the check.
      Parameters:
      cardID - ID of the card to be placed
      placePos - position of the card on which to place the card
      cornerDir - corner direction on which to place the card
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the card can't be placed at the time of invocation. The exception message explains the reason in greater detail.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the player does not have the requested card in hand.

    • validateDraw

      public void validateDraw(char deck, int card) throws IllegalStateException, IllegalArgumentException
      Validates whether the place card command can be run.
      Successfully returning from this method means passing the check.
      Parameters:
      deck - char indicating the deck from which to draw (R/G)
      card - position of the card to draw
      (0=top, 1,2=first,second revealed)
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the player can't draw the requested deck-card combination. The exception message explains the reason in greater detail.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the requested deck-card combination is invalid. The exception message explains the reason in greater detail.

    • validateRestart

      public void validateRestart(int numOfPlayers) throws IllegalStateException, IllegalArgumentException
      Validates whether the restart game command can be run.
      Successfully returning from this method means passing the check.
      Parameters:
      numOfPlayers - number of players required to start the new game
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the player can't currently restart the game. The exception message explains the reason in greater detail.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the numOfPlayers argument is invalid (<2 or >4). The exception message explains the reason in greater detail.

    • validateMsg

      public void validateMsg(String addressee) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Validates whether a chat message can be sent to addressee Successfully returning from this method means passing the check.
      Parameters:
      addressee - the nickname of the addressee of the chat message, or "all" if broadcasting the message.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the addressee nickname is invalid. The exception message explains the reason in greater detail.

    • getSelfPlayArea

      public ViewPlayArea getSelfPlayArea()
      Returns the local player's ViewPlayArea
      Returns:
      local player's ViewPlayArea

      public ViewPlayCard getSelfCardById(String id)
      Returns the local player's card in hand with given ID
      Parameters:
      id - card ID to return
      Returns:
      local player's card in hand with given ID

    • getSelfStartingCard

      public ViewStartCard getSelfStartingCard()
      Returns the local player's starting card (could be null)
      Returns:
      local player's starting card (could be null)

    • setSelfPlayerArea

      public void setSelfPlayerArea()
      Sets the local player's ViewPlayArea reference in the ViewController

    • addLocalPlayer

      public void addLocalPlayer(String nickname)
      Creates the local player in the ViewBoard
      Parameters:
      nickname - the local player's nickname

    • getPlayer

      public ViewHand getPlayer(String nickname)
      Returns the hand of the player with given nickname.
      Due to ViewBoard implementation, it also runs addOpponent() if the given nickname doesn't correspond to the local player or to any opponent in game.
      Parameters:
      nickname - a player nickname
      Returns:
      the ViewHand of the player with given nickname.

    • isLocalPlayer

      public boolean isLocalPlayer(String nickname)
      Returns a boolean indicating if the nickname corresponds to the local player's nickname.
      Parameters:
      nickname - a player nickname
      Returns:
      true if the nickname corresponds to the local player's nickname.

    • getLocalPlayer

      public ViewPlayerHand getLocalPlayer()
      Returns the local player's hand.
      Returns:
      the local player's hand.

    • getObjectiveCardIndex

      public int getObjectiveCardIndex(ViewObjectiveCard comparedCard) throws IllegalStateException
      Loops through the objectives in hand and returns the index of the first objective card matching the argument.
      Parameters:
      comparedCard - the objective card to find
      Returns:
      the index of the given objective card in hand.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the objective card is not in hand.
